description.narrative: To assist national, as well as regional, parliamentarians in ensuring implementation of Sustainable Development Goals 5, 14 and 16 in ODA-eligible countries, including to end CEFM as well as discrimination based on SOGI.

organisation.narrative: Permanent Mission of Denmark to the United Nations, New York, USA

mailing-address.narrative: Chrysler East Building, 666 Third Avenue, 11th Floor

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: SDG Target 16.b – Parliamentary Campaign Against Discrimination based on Sexual Orientation and Gender Identity: Parliamentarians mobilized to take actions to guarantee that all individuals have equal value, live with dignity and are able to achieve their highest potential free from all forms of violence and discrimination, including on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity and expression and sex characteristics (SOGI).

Parliamentarians from ODA-eligible countries take concrete actions to promote equality and inclusion of LGBTI people such as: publishing op-eds, speaking publicly in parliament or in their constituencies, calling on the Executive and discussing/introducing parliamentary initiatives, motions and resolutions, strengthening legislation to promote inclusion of LGBTI people.

target.value: 1) Increased understanding of at least 10 MPs from Caribbean and Pacific regions about their role in ensuring equality and inclusion of LGBTI people. 2) Co-organized and ensured participation of MPs from ODA-eligible countries in the Inter-Parliamentary Assembly at Copenhagen 2021. 3) Convened at least one dialogue between MPs and LGBT civil society in ODA-eligible countries.

1) Increased understanding of at least 10 MPs from Caribbean and Pacific regions about their role in ensuring equality and inclusion of LGBTI people. 2) Co-organized and ensured participation of MPs from ODA-eligible countries in the Inter-Parliamentary Assembly at Copenhagen 2021. 3) Convened at least one dialogue between MPs and LGBT civil society in ODA-eligible countries. At least 20 parliamentarians sensitized, at least two dialogues held and at least 4 concrete follow-up actions taken to promote equality and inclusion of LGBTI people in ODA-eligible countries.

title.narrative: SDG Target 5.3 – Campaign to End Child, Early and Forced Marriage (CEFM): Parliamentarians in target ODA-eligible countries have improved knowledge of CEFM and demonstrate political will to create an enabling legal and policy frameworks that, in addition to establishing 18 as the legal age of marriage for both boys and girls with no exceptions, also guarantees girls’ human rights, including those married and/ or in informal unions, in their equal access to education, sexual and reproductive health and rights, employment, justice and political participation.

Targeted parliamentarians take concrete actions to address CEFM as a human rights violation, crime against humanity and a development issue, such as: calling on the Executive and discussing/ introducing parliamentary initiatives, motions and resolutions strengthening legislation to promote and protect girls’ human rights.

target.value: Meetings of parliamentarians with civil society representatives and other key stakeholders to exchange information about CEFM in at least two ODA-eligible countries, including Kenya.
PGA members in Kenya contributed to establishing a national strategy to end CEFM.

title.narrative: SDG 16 – PGA’s Democratic Renewal and Human Rights Campaign: contributes to protection of civil and political democratic space and the human rights of parliamentarians, especially those in opposition, women in politics and minorities and vulnerable groups.

PGA’s Parliamentary Rapid Response Team (PARRT) publishes urgent action alerts and takes other targeted actions on situation in ODA-eligible countries where democratic principles and human lives are at stake.

target.value: PARRT takes targeted actions on at least two situations in ODA-eligible countries where democratic principles and human lives are at stake (e.g. Ethiopia, Myanmar, Zimbabwe, El Salvador).

PARRT takes targeted actions on at least two additional situations in ODA-eligible countries where democratic principles and human lives are at stake. PAART actions on at least 4 situations in ODA- eligible countries leads to parliamentary initiatives, motions and resolutions, as well as individual sanctions where appropriate (e.g. Magnitsky-type sanctions).
